text: Avoid the ASUS TUF Gaming FX504GD-RS51 15.6" Intel Core i5 8th Gen 8300H (2.30 GHz) NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 8 GB Memory 1 TB FireCuda SSHD (8 GB SSD Cache) Windows 10 Home 64-Bit Gaming Laptop if you can. The NVIDIA GTX 1050 is okay, but the cons outweigh the pros. Fans get extremely loud, like a jet engine.. Looking to return it.

It's a decent gaming laptop for the money. Performance is good for most games like Valorant, but it can struggle a bit with the newest AAA titles on ultra settings with the ASUS TUF Gaming FX504GD-RS51 15.6" Intel Core i5 8th Gen 8300H (2.30 GHz) NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 8 GB Memory 1 TB FireCuda SSHD (8 GB SSD Cache) Windows 10 Home 64-Bit Gaming Laptop. The speakers is okay, not great. Overall, it gets the job done.

Avoid the ASUS TUF Gaming FX504GD-RS51 15.6" Intel Core i5 8th Gen 8300H (2.30 GHz) NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 8 GB Memory 1 TB FireCuda SSHD (8 GB SSD Cache) Windows 10 Home 64-Bit Gaming Laptop if you can. The NVIDIA GTX 1050 is okay, but the cons outweigh the pros. The screen developed dead pixels within a month.. Looking to return it.

Quite disappointed with this laptop, the ASUS TUF Gaming FX504GD-RS51 15.6" Intel Core i5 8th Gen 8300H (2.30 GHz) NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 8 GB Memory 1 TB FireCuda SSHD (8 GB SSD Cache) Windows 10 Home 64-Bit Gaming Laptop. It blue screens occasionally frequently when playing Cyberpunk 2077, and the performance throttles significantly. The battery life has been a letdown. Wouldn't recommend.

It's a decent gaming laptop for the money. Performance is good for most games like Call of Duty: Warzone, but it can struggle a bit with the newest AAA titles on ultra settings with the ASUS TUF Gaming FX504GD-RS51 15.6" Intel Core i5 8th Gen 8300H (2.30 GHz) NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 8 GB Memory 1 TB FireCuda SSHD (8 GB SSD Cache) Windows 10 Home 64-Bit Gaming Laptop. The screen brightness is okay, not great. Overall, it gets the job done.
